intro: Cayratia lanceolata, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
